intro: Euploca bursifera, commonly known as the burr grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bristly seed heads that resemble small burs. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, pale blue or purple flowers. Euploca bursifera is often found in coastal areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
